{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20843v1", "title": "A nuclear mass model rooted in chiral effective field theory", "summary": "We develop a nuclear mass model that is based on chiral effective field
theory at next-to-next-to leading order. Nuclear binding energies are computed
via the Hartree-Fock method using a Hamiltonian from delta-full chiral
effective field theory. We employ Hartree-Fock emulators to adjust $11$
low-energy constants in the chiral interaction to binding energies of $18$
even-even nuclei. When applied to $107$ even-even nuclei with mass numbers
$16\leq A\leq 56$ the chiral mass model exhibits an overall root-mean-square
deviation of $3.5$ MeV.", "main_category": "nucl-th", "categories": "nucl-th", "published": "2025-04-29T15:13:19Z"}
